9  cv::Mat OpenCVMatching::getCameraMatrix(const std::string path) {
10  cv::Mat temp;
11  cv::FileStorage fs(path, cv::FileStorage::READ);
12  fs["camera_matrix"] >> temp;
13  fs.release();
14 
15  return temp;
16  }

27  std::string OpenCVMatching::type2str(int type) {
28  std::string r;
29 
30  uchar depth = type & CV_MAT_DEPTH_MASK;
31  uchar chans = 1 + (type >> CV_CN_SHIFT);
32 
33  switch (depth) {
34  case CV_8U:
35  r = "8U";
36  break;
37  case CV_8S:
38  r = "8S";
39  break;
40  case CV_16U:
41  r = "16U";
42  break;
43  case CV_16S:
44  r = "16S";
45  break;
46  case CV_32S:
47  r = "32S";
48  break;
49  case CV_32F:
50  r = "32F";
51  break;
52  case CV_64F:
53  r = "64F";
54  break;
55  default:
56  r = "User";
57  break;
58  }
59 
60  r += "C";
61  r += (chans + '0');
62 
63  // USAGE
64  // std::string ty = type2str( H.type() );
65  // printf("Matrix: %s %dx%d \n", ty.c_str(), H.cols, H.rows );
66 
67  return r;
68  }
69 
70  cv::Mat OpenCVMatching::captureFrame(bool color, bool useCalibration, cv::VideoCapture capture,
71  cv::Mat cameraMatrix, cv::Mat distCoeffs) {
72  cv::Mat inFrame, outFrame;
73  capture >> inFrame;
74 
75  // Check if frame should be color or grayscale
76  if (color == false && useCalibration == false) {
77  cv::cvtColor(inFrame, outFrame, CV_RGB2GRAY); // grayscale
78  } else if (color == false && useCalibration == true) {
79  cv::Mat temp;
80  cv::undistort(inFrame, temp, cameraMatrix, distCoeffs);
81  cv::cvtColor(temp, outFrame, CV_RGB2GRAY); // grayscale
82  } else if (color == true && useCalibration == false) {
83  outFrame = inFrame;
84  } else {
85  cv::undistort(inFrame, outFrame, cameraMatrix, distCoeffs);
86  }
87 
88  return outFrame;
89  }
90 
91  cv::Mat OpenCVMatching::captureFrame(bool color, cv::VideoCapture capture) {
92  cv::Mat inFrame, outFrame;
93  capture >> inFrame;
94  if(color) {
95  outFrame = inFrame;
96  } else {
97  cv::cvtColor(inFrame, outFrame, CV_RGB2GRAY);
98  }
99  return outFrame;
100  }
101 
102  std::vector<cv::DMatch> OpenCVMatching::knnMatchDescriptors(cv::Mat descriptors_object, cv::Mat descriptors_scene,
103  float nnratio) {
104  cv::FlannBasedMatcher matcher;
105  std::vector<std::vector<cv::DMatch> > matches;
106 
107  // Match descriptors
108  matcher.knnMatch(descriptors_object, descriptors_scene, matches, 2);
109 
110  std::vector<cv::DMatch> good_matches;
111  good_matches.reserve(matches.size());
112 
113  for (size_t i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
114  if (matches[i].size() < 2)
115  continue;
116 
117  const cv::DMatch &m1 = matches[i][0];
118  const cv::DMatch &m2 = matches[i][1];
119 
120  if (m1.distance <= nnratio * m2.distance)
121  good_matches.push_back(m1);
122  }
123 
124  return good_matches;
125  }
126 
127  std::vector<cv::DMatch> OpenCVMatching::knnMatchDescriptorsLSH(cv::Mat descriptors_object,
128  cv::Mat descriptors_scene, float nndrRatio) {
129  cv::FlannBasedMatcher matcher(new cv::flann::LshIndexParams(20, 10, 2));
130  std::vector<std::vector<cv::DMatch> > matches;
131 
132  // Match descriptors
133  matcher.knnMatch(descriptors_object, descriptors_scene, matches, 2);
134 
135  std::vector<cv::DMatch> good_matches;
136  good_matches.reserve(matches.size());
137 
138  for (size_t i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
139  if (matches[i].size() < 2)
140  continue;
141 
142  const cv::DMatch &m1 = matches[i][0];
143  const cv::DMatch &m2 = matches[i][1];
144 
145  if (m1.distance <= nndrRatio * m2.distance)
146  good_matches.push_back(m1);
147  }
148 
149  return good_matches;
150  }
151 
152  std::vector<cv::DMatch> OpenCVMatching::matchDescriptors(cv::Mat descriptors_object, cv::Mat descriptors_scene) {
153  // Good at filtering FLANN based match.
154  cv::FlannBasedMatcher matcher;
155  std::vector<cv::DMatch> matches;
156 
157  // Match descriptors
158  matcher.match(descriptors_object, descriptors_scene, matches);
159 
160  double max_dist = 0;
161  double min_dist = 100;
162 
163  // Compute the max and min distance of the matches in current videoFrame
164  for (int i = 0; i < descriptors_object.rows; i++) {
165  double dist = matches[i].distance;
166  if (dist < min_dist) min_dist = dist;
167  if (dist > max_dist) max_dist = dist;
168  }
169 
170  std::vector<cv::DMatch> good_matches;
171 
172  // Remove bad matches
173  double k = 2;
174  for (int i = 0; i < descriptors_object.rows; i++) {
175  if (matches[i].distance <= cv::max(k * min_dist, 0.02)) {
176  good_matches.push_back(matches[i]);
177  }
178  }
179 
180  return good_matches;
181  }
182 
183  std::vector<cv::DMatch> OpenCVMatching::bruteForce(cv::Mat descriptors_object, cv::Mat descriptors_scene,
184  int normType) {
185  cv::BFMatcher matcher(normType);
186  std::vector<std::vector<cv::DMatch> > matches;
187  matcher.knnMatch(descriptors_object, descriptors_scene, matches, 2);
188 
189 // look whether the match is inside a defined area of the image
190 // only 25% of maximum of possible distance
191 // double tresholdDist = 0.25 * sqrt(double(object.size().height*object.size().height
192 // +object.size().width*object.size().width));
193 
194  std::vector<cv::DMatch> good_matches;
195  for (int i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
196  const float ratio = 0.9; // As in Lowe's paper; can be tuned
197  if (matches[i][0].distance < ratio * matches[i][1].distance) {
198  good_matches.push_back(matches[i][0]);
199  }
200  }
201 
202  return good_matches;
203  }
204 
205  cv::Ptr<cv::Feature2D> OpenCVMatching::setKeyPointsDetector(std::string typeKeyPoint) {
206  cv::Ptr<cv::Feature2D> detector;
207  if (typeKeyPoint == "SURF") {
208  detector = cv::xfeatures2d::SURF::create(1000,4,5,false,false);
209  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
210  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "SIFT") {
211  detector = cv::xfeatures2d::SIFT::create(0,5,0.04,10,1.6);
212  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
213  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "STAR") {
214  detector = cv::xfeatures2d::StarDetector::create(45,30,10,8,5);
215  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
216  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "BRISK") {
217  detector = cv::BRISK::create(30,3,1.0f);
218  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
219  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "FAST") {
220  detector = cv::FastFeatureDetector::create(10,true,cv::FastFeatureDetector::TYPE_9_16);
221  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
222  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "ORB") {
223  detector = cv::ORB::create(1000,1.2f,8,31,0,2,cv::ORB::FAST_SCORE,31,20);
224  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
225  } else if (typeKeyPoint == "AKAZE") {
226  detector = cv::AKAZE::create(cv::AKAZE::DESCRIPTOR_MLDB,0,3,0.001f,4,4,cv::KAZE::DIFF_PM_G2);
227  ROS_INFO("Keypoint detector: %s", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
228  } else {
229  ROS_ERROR("Could not find keypoint detector: %s\n\tChoosing default: SURF", typeKeyPoint.c_str());
230  detector = cv::xfeatures2d::SURF::create(1000);
231  }
232  return detector;
233  }
234 
235  cv::Ptr<cv::Feature2D> OpenCVMatching::setDescriptorsExtractor(std::string typeDescriptor, bool &binary) {
236  cv::Ptr<cv::Feature2D> extractor;
237  if (typeDescriptor == "SURF") {
238  binary = false;
239  extractor = cv::xfeatures2d::SURF::create(1000,4,5,false,false);
240  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
241  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
242  } else if (typeDescriptor == "SIFT") {
243  binary = false;
244  extractor = cv::xfeatures2d::SIFT::create(0,5,0.04,10,1.6);
245  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
246  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
247  } else if (typeDescriptor == "BRISK") {
248  binary = true;
249  extractor = cv::BRISK::create(30,3,1.0f);
250  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
251  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
252  } else if (typeDescriptor == "FREAK") {
253  binary = true;
254  extractor = cv::xfeatures2d::FREAK::create(true,true,22.0f,4);
255  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
256  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
257  } else if (typeDescriptor == "ORB") {
258  binary = true;
259  extractor = cv::ORB::create(1000,1.2f,8,31,0,2,cv::ORB::FAST_SCORE,31,20); // WTA_K = 3-4 -> HAMMING2
260  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
261  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
262  } else if (typeDescriptor == "AKAZE") {
263  binary = true;
264  extractor = cv::AKAZE::create(cv::AKAZE::DESCRIPTOR_MLDB,0,3,0.001f,4,4,cv::KAZE::DIFF_PM_G2);
265  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
266  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
267  } else if (typeDescriptor == "BRIEF") {
268  binary = true;
269  extractor = cv::xfeatures2d::BriefDescriptorExtractor::create(32, true);
270  ROS_INFO("Descriptor: %s", typeDescriptor.c_str());
271  ROS_INFO("Binary matching: %d", binary);
272  } else {
273  binary = false;
274  ROS_ERROR("Could not find keypoint detector: %s\n\tChoosing default descriptor: SURF", typeDescriptor.c_str());
275  extractor = cv::xfeatures2d::SURF::create(1000);
276  }
277  return extractor;
278  }
279 
280  CurrentMatch OpenCVMatching::visualizedMatch(cv::Mat searchImage, cv::Mat objectImage,
281  std::vector<cv::KeyPoint> keypointsObject,
282  std::vector<cv::KeyPoint> keypointsScene,
283  std::vector<cv::DMatch> good_matches,
284  bool showKeypoints, int homographyType) {
285 
286  cv::Mat image_matches;
287 
288  if (showKeypoints) {
289  cv::drawKeypoints(searchImage, keypointsScene, image_matches, cv::Scalar::all(-1),
290  cv::DrawMatchesFlags::NOT_DRAW_SINGLE_POINTS); // cv::Scalar::all(-1)
291 // cv::drawMatches(objectImage, keypointsObject, searchImage, keypointsScene, good_matches, image_matches,
292 // cv::Scalar::all(-1), cv::Scalar::all(-1), std::vector<char>(),
293 // cv::DrawMatchesFlags::NOT_DRAW_SINGLE_POINTS);
294  } else {
295  image_matches = searchImage.clone();
296  }
297 
298  std::vector<cv::Point2f> obj;
299  std::vector<cv::Point2f> scene;
300 
301  for (size_t i = 0; i < good_matches.size(); i++) {
302  // Retrieve the keypoints from good matches
303  obj.push_back(keypointsObject[good_matches[i].queryIdx].pt);
304  scene.push_back(keypointsScene[good_matches[i].trainIdx].pt);
305  }
306 
307  // Perform Homography to find a perspective transformation between two planes.
308  cv::Mat H;
309  if (!obj.size() == 0 && !scene.size() == 0) {
310  H = cv::findHomography(obj, scene, homographyType); // CV_LMEDS // CV_RANSAC
311  }
312 
313  std::vector<cv::Point2f> objectCorners(4);
314 
315  // Put object corners in a vector
316  objectCorners[0] = cvPoint(0, 0); //Upper left corner
317  objectCorners[1] = cvPoint(objectImage.cols, 0); //Upper right corner
318  objectCorners[2] = cvPoint(objectImage.cols, objectImage.rows); //Lower right corner
319  objectCorners[3] = cvPoint(0, objectImage.rows); //Lower left corner
320 
321  std::vector<cv::Point2f> sceneCorners(4);
322 
323  // Find the object corners in the scene perspective
324  if (!H.rows == 0 && !H.cols == 0) {
325  cv::perspectiveTransform(objectCorners, sceneCorners, H);
326 
327  if (checkObjectInnerAngles(sceneCorners, 60, 120)) {
328  // Draw lines surrounding the object
329  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[0], sceneCorners[1], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 2); //TOP line
330  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[1], sceneCorners[2], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 2); //RIGHT line
331  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[2], sceneCorners[3], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 2); //BOTTOM line
332  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[3], sceneCorners[0], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 2); //LEFT line
333  // Draw diagonals
334  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[0], sceneCorners[2], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 1); //DIAGONAL 0-2
335  cv::line(image_matches, sceneCorners[1], sceneCorners[3], cv::Scalar(0, 255, 0), 1); //DIAGONAL 1-3
336 
337  // Center
338  cv::Point2f cen(0.0, 0.0);
339  if (intersection(sceneCorners[0], sceneCorners[2], sceneCorners[1], sceneCorners[3], cen)) {
340  cv::circle(image_matches, cen, 10, cv::Scalar(0, 0, 255), 2);
341  }
342  }
343  }
344 
345  // Draw circles in center pixel of the video stream
346  if (searchImage.rows > 60 && searchImage.cols > 60) {
347  cv::circle(image_matches, cv::Point(searchImage.cols / 2, searchImage.rows / 2), 5, CV_RGB(255, 0, 0));
348  cv::circle(image_matches, cv::Point(searchImage.cols / 2, searchImage.rows / 2), 10, CV_RGB(0, 255, 0));
349  cv::circle(image_matches, cv::Point(searchImage.cols / 2, searchImage.rows / 2), 15, CV_RGB(0, 0, 255));
350  }
351 
352  CurrentMatch cm;
353  cm.outFrame = image_matches;
354  cm.sceneCorners = sceneCorners;
355 
356  return cm;
357  }
358 
359  bool OpenCVMatching::intersection(cv::Point2f o1, cv::Point2f p1, cv::Point2f o2, cv::Point2f p2, cv::Point2f &r) {
360  // The lines are defined by (o1, p1) and (o2, p2).
361  cv::Point2f x = o2 - o1;
362  cv::Point2f d1 = p1 - o1;
363  cv::Point2f d2 = p2 - o2;
364 
365  float cross = d1.x * d2.y - d1.y * d2.x;
366  if (fabsf(cross) < /*EPS*/1e-8)
367  return false;
368 
369  double t1 = (x.x * d2.y - x.y * d2.x) / cross;
370  r = o1 + d1 * t1;
371  return true;
372  }
373 
374  int OpenCVMatching::innerAngle(cv::Point2f a, cv::Point2f b, cv::Point2f c) {
375  cv::Point2f ab(b.x - a.x, b.y - a.y);
376  cv::Point2f cb(b.x - c.x, b.y - c.y);
377 
378  double dot = (ab.x * cb.x + ab.y * cb.y); // dot product
379  double cross = (ab.x * cb.y - ab.y * cb.x); // cross product
380 
381  double alpha = atan2(cross, dot);
382 
383  int angle = (int) floor(alpha * 180. / PI + 0.5);
384  //alpha = alpha * 180 / PI;
385 
386  return abs(angle);
387  }
388 
389  bool OpenCVMatching::checkObjectInnerAngles(std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner, int min, int max) {
390  bool out = false;
391  int c0 = innerAngle(scorner[3], scorner[0], scorner[1]);
392  int c1 = innerAngle(scorner[0], scorner[1], scorner[2]);
393  int c2 = innerAngle(scorner[1], scorner[2], scorner[3]);
394  int c3 = innerAngle(scorner[2], scorner[3], scorner[0]);
395 
396  if (c0 > min && c0 < max && c1 > min && c1 < max && c2 > min && c2 < max && c3 > min && c3 < max) out = true;
397 
398  return out;
399  }
400 
401  double OpenCVMatching::getXoffset(cv::Mat frame, std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner) {
402  cv::Point2f cen;
403  double xOffset = 0.0;
404 
405  if (intersection(scorner[0], scorner[2], scorner[1], scorner[3], cen)) {
406  xOffset = cen.x - frame.cols / 2;
407  }
408 
409  return xOffset;
410  }
411 
412  double OpenCVMatching::getYoffset(cv::Mat frame, std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner) {
413  cv::Point2f cen;
414  double yOffset = 0.0;
415 
416  if (intersection(scorner[0], scorner[2], scorner[1], scorner[3], cen)) {
417  yOffset = cen.y - frame.rows / 2;
418  }
419 
420  return yOffset;
421  }
422 
423  double OpenCVMatching::getXpos(std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner) {
424  cv::Point2f cen;
425  intersection(scorner[0], scorner[2], scorner[1], scorner[3], cen);
426  double x = cen.x;
427  return x;
428  }
429 
430  double OpenCVMatching::getYpos(std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner) {
431  cv::Point2f cen;
432  intersection(scorner[0], scorner[2], scorner[1], scorner[3], cen);
433  double y = cen.y;
434  return y;
435  }
436 
437  double OpenCVMatching::getObjectAngle(cv::Mat frame, std::vector<cv::Point2f> scorner) {
438 
439  double centerX = frame.cols / 2;
440  double diffX = centerX - scorner[1].x;
441  double x = (centerX - diffX) - scorner[0].x;
442 
443  double y = scorner[0].y - scorner[1].y;
444 
445  double angle = atan2(y, x) * 180 / PI;
446  return angle;
447  }
448 
449  Eigen::Vector3d OpenCVMatching::getNormImageCoords(double x, double y, double lambda, cv::Mat camera_matrix) {
450  Eigen::Vector3d pixelCoords;
451  Eigen::Vector3d normCoords;
452  Eigen::Matrix3d camMat;
453 
454  camMat << camera_matrix.at<double>(0,0),0,camera_matrix.at<double>(0,2),
455  0,camera_matrix.at<double>(1,1),camera_matrix.at<double>(1,2),
456  0,0,1;
457 
458  pixelCoords(0) = x;
459  pixelCoords(1) = y;
460  pixelCoords(2) = 1;
461 
462  Eigen::Matrix3d icamMat = camMat.inverse();
463 
464  normCoords = icamMat*pixelCoords;
465  return lambda*normCoords;
466  }
467 }
